chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Hypotheses:

Init.Nat.lor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise orb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Nat.lcm = fun a b : nat => a * (b / Nat.gcd a b) : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.lxor = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise xorb (Init.Nat.max a b) a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Nat.ones = fun n : nat => Nat.pred (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Init.Nat.ldiff = fun a b : nat => Init.Nat.bitwise (fun b0 b' : bool => (b0 && negb b')%bool) a a b : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]

neq = fun x y : nat => x <> y : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]

tail_plus = fix tail_plus (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n0 => tail_plus n0 (S m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]

Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]

Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Argument m is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [nat_scope _]
